intro: Lacunaria, commonly known as the lace fern, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lacy foliage that gives it its common name. The leaves are typically arranged in a whorled pattern and often have a translucent or semi-transparent appearance. Lacunaria species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their unique and intricate leaf structures.
